term.title: reduced adsorption

item.text: Of component i, defined by the equation Γ i n = Γ i σ- Γ i c i α- c i , cα and cβ are, respectively, the total Gibbs surface concentration and the total concentrations in the bulk phases α and β: Γ σ = ∑ i Γ i σ when the Gibbs surface is chosen so that Γ σ is zero, i.e. the Gibbs surface is chosen so that the reference system has not only the same volume, but also contains the same total amount of substance(n) as the real system.

item.alttext: Γ i n = Γ i σ- Γ i c i α- c i
Γ σ = ∑ i Γ i σ
